definition: to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)

sentences.english: The two people are composing verses, using the same rhyme sequence.
sentences.chinese: 这两个人在一起吟咏作诗，相互唱酬。

sentences.english: Chanting weapons through poems is a unique phenomenon in ancient Chinese culture.
sentences.chinese: 以诗歌吟咏兵器，是中国古代文化的独特现象。

sentences.english: And tears are heard within the harp I touch.
sentences.chinese: 我抚琴吟咏，却听到泪水流淌。

sentences.english: Do not want to secularization, as early as disposable examination, to recite from the appropriate reading.
sentences.chinese: 不愿仕进，早弃科举，以读书吟咏自适。

sentences.english: Good chant, self his poems as "original series", in order of Tao Valley.
sentences.chinese: 好吟咏，自编其诗为《正本集》，陶谷为序。

sentences.english: The moon plays a big role in literature and song.
sentences.chinese: 月亮在歌赋和文学作品中向来是吟咏的一大主题。
吟咏仍在继续，声音空灵而虔诚。

definition: to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
to chant/to recite rhythmically/to polish verse
antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus)/sung reply (in agreement with first voice)/to reply with a poem in the same rhythm
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
a poem/a composition in verse/fig. epic (compared with historical epic)/the biblical Book of Psalms
